long_desc.thetext:
The #ignore compiler hint currently only matches full class names. However, it should support wildcards, so that
#ignore(foo.*)
will match foo.bar, foo.baz, etc.

I'd say this issue isn't receiving as much attention as it should because Christian didn't link the original thread [1] here.
Could you do that, Christian? It made much more sense if it was you doing that, after the request from Chris.
[1] http://old.nabble.com/%22Unknown-global-symbol-referenced%22-despite--ignore%28%29-td27200778.html
Thanks for alerting me to this. Posted a note at the ML.

Implemented, '*' is recognized as wildcard for any character in the symbol name.
with r28423.
